XPolicies

There are certain rules and policies that will have to be applied to any role, as well as users and groups depending upon their rights. You can use the XPolicies entity to create the different policies that can be applied to the users, groups and roles.

Adding new policies

To add new policies that you would need for different user groups and roles of your project ,

  1. Select the XPolicies entity. The xpolicies list window is displayed.
  2. Select Add. The Add xpolicies window is displayed.
  3. Enter Name and Description for the specific policy. These fields are mandatory.
  4. Click Save. The new policy is now added to your project.

Deleting policy

If any policy is to be removed, you can delete them from the list using Delete function.

To delete a policy :

  1. Under XPolicies list, click to select the policy to be deleted.
  2. Click Delete. The selected policy is deleted. If you select multiple policies from the list, you can delete multiple policies as well.

    Note:

    1. In case you do not select a policy, an error message is displayed stating “XPolicy not selected”.

Editing policies

You can edit the details for a specific policy like policy name and description as well as the statements linked to it. To edit the policy details, under xpolicies list, select the policy from the list and click Edit. The Edit xpolicies window appears. Using the Edit function, the following entities / functionalities can be applied:

To edit policies,

  1. Click to select the policy to be modified and click Edit.
  2. The Edit xpolicies window allows you to modify the policy name, description, user, group and policies. You can also Add the policy statement.
    1. Under XPolicy, click Edit and select Statements.
    2. Under Statements, click Add.
    3. Enter Service Filter, Resource Filter, Action Filter and Effect. Click Save to add the statement details.

Refresh

For all entities you will be able to Refresh that page to reflect the latest data and functions applicable for the entity.
